question: Match the following:
columnB: Semen is released by the penis into the vagina (insemination)
Cervix → uterus → ampullary region of fallopian tube
Ovum and sperms must be transported simultaneously to the ampullary region
Blocks entry of additional sperms ensuring only one sperm fertilises the ovum

answer.During copulation (coitus): Semen is released by the penis into the vagina (insemination)
answer.Sperms swim through: Cervix → uterus → ampullary region of fallopian tube
answer.Requirement for fertilisation: Ovum and sperms must be transported simultaneously to the ampullary region
answer.Function of zona pellucida changes: Blocks entry of additional sperms ensuring only one sperm fertilises the ovum

question: Match the following:
columnA: Process of fusion of sperm with ovum
Why not all copulations lead to pregnancy
columnB: Help sperm enter cytoplasm of ovum
Break zona pellucida and plasma membrane
Ovum and sperms may not reach ampullary region simultaneously
Ovum is transported to ampullary region

answer.Acrosome secretions: Help sperm enter cytoplasm of ovum
answer.Purpose of acrosome enzymes: Break zona pellucida and plasma membrane
answer.Why not all copulations lead to pregnanc: Ovum and sperms may not reach ampullary region simultaneously
answer.Ovum transport: Ovum is transported to ampullary region
